column2: "When one stream flows, many side streams are born. That theorem is divine providence."
"There is hardly any true value in each of those endings."
"To I and We it is unnecessary. Yet we understand it is indispensible to you."
"If you disagree, it ends there. I and We understand and accepted it, and you accept it."
"...No, it is not for me to say if I accepted it or not."
"It is up to you to decide what you learn from the new stream."
"I and We are here to observe and accept your decision."
